intro: Ervatamia obtusiuscula, commonly known as the narrow-leaf desert bell, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its narrow, gray-green leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures. Its botanical features make it an important component of desert ecosystems.
